snippet: A House committee on Tuesday shelved a religious objections bill pushed by Gov. Bobby Jindal that has thrust the state into the national debate about religious freedoms and the rights of same-sex couples.
abstract: Both Democrats and Republicans on House committee in Louisiana vote again religious objections bill backed by Gov Bobby Jindal that would protect those who have taken actions due to religious belief or moral conviction against same-sex marriage from state.
lead_paragraph: A House committee on Tuesday shelved a religious objections bill pushed by Gov. Bobby Jindal that has thrust the state into the national debate about religious freedoms and the rights of same-sex couples.

headline.main: Louisiana: House Shelves Religious Objections Bill
headline.print_headline: Louisiana: House Shelves Religious Objections Bill

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
